turn.1: What is the difference between the former city of North York and the current city of Yorkview?
turn.2: Yorkview Yorkview was an Ontario provincial electoral district (riding), in the former city of North York from 1963 to 1999.
turn.4: The riding was established for the 1963 Ontario general election.
turn.6: The riding was abolished in preparation for the 1999 Ontario general election.
turn.8: It was partitioned into the current provincial ridings of York West, York Centre and York South—Weston.
turn.9: Who were some of the MPPs?
turn.10: Its first and longest-serving Member of Provincial Parliament (MPP) was Fred Young, who served the riding as a Ontario New Democratic Party (NDP) member, from 1963 until his retirement in 1981.
turn.12: The last MPP to represent the riding was Ontario Liberal Party member, Mario Sergio.
